title: Zechariah Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Zechariah with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 14 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the prophet author of the book of Zechariah?
questions.explanation: Zechariah, son of Berechiah, is the prophet to whom the visions and oracles were given.

questions.question: In Zechariah 1, what did the man riding the red horse stand among?
questions.explanation: The man on the red horse stood among the myrtle trees in the bottom.

questions.question: What do the four horns in Zechariah 1 symbolize?
questions.explanation: The four horns represent the powers that scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.

questions.question: What is the significance of the four carpenters in Zechariah 1?
questions.explanation: The carpenters come to terrify and cast out the horns that scattered Judah.

questions.question: What did the angel say the LORD of hosts was jealous for, in Zechariah 1?
questions.explanation: God expressed great jealousy for Jerusalem and Zion.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 2, who is the one that will be a wall of fire around Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: The LORD himself will be a wall of fire around Jerusalem and glory within.

questions.question: What promise is given to the people in Zechariah 2 concerning the nations?
questions.explanation: Many nations will join themselves to the LORD in that day.

questions.question: What did the high priest Joshua wear when Zechariah saw him standing before the angel of the LORD in Zechariah 3?
questions.explanation: Joshua stood before the angel clothed with filthy garments symbolizing sin.

questions.question: What was done to Joshua's filthy garments in Zechariah 3?
options: They were given to the people
questions.explanation: The filthy garments were taken away and he was clothed with rich apparel.

questions.question: Who is called the 'Branch' in Zechariah 3?
questions.explanation: The Branch refers to the future righteous king and priest, a Messianic title.

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 4 teaches that the rebuilding of the temple will be accomplished by might and power.
questions.explanation: The rebuilding will be by the Spirit of the LORD, not by might or power.

questions.question: What object did Zechariah see that had seven lamps and two olive trees beside it?
questions.explanation: The vision was of a golden candlestick with seven lamps and two olive trees.

questions.question: Who are the 'two anointed ones' mentioned in Zechariah 4?
questions.explanation: They represent the priest and the governor who stand by the Lord.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'headstone' Zerubbabel will bring forth according to Zechariah 4?
questions.explanation: The headstone is the capstone of the temple foundation completed with shoutings.

questions.question: True or False: In Zechariah 7, the people questioned whether they should continue mourning in the fifth month as their ancestors did.
questions.explanation: They asked if they should weep and fast as in former years during the fifth month.

questions.question: What reason does the LORD give in Zechariah 7 for why fasting had not been truly for Him?
options: They fasted for themselves, not unto God
They fasted on the wrong days
questions.correctAnswer: They fasted for themselves, not unto God
questions.explanation: God says their fasting was for themselves, not unto Him.

questions.question: What does Zechariah 7 command the people to do instead of just fasting?
options: Execute true judgment and show mercy
questions.correctAnswer: Execute true judgment and show mercy
questions.explanation: God commands to practice justice, mercy, and compassion toward others.

questions.question: True or False: In Zechariah 8, the LORD promises to return to Zion and dwell in Jerusalem with mercy.
questions.explanation: God promises to return to Zion and Jerusalem with mercy and peace.

questions.question: What will the streets of Jerusalem be called in Zechariah 8?
questions.explanation: Jerusalem's streets will be full of boys and girls playing and called holy.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The LORD of hosts saith this, Yet once more, ________ shall be shaken, and I will shake all nations.'
questions.explanation: The verse speaks of shaking heaven and earth as part of God's judgment.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 9, which city will be a stronghold for the house of Judah?
questions.explanation: Jerusalem is described as a strong city and a heavy stone to the enemies.

questions.question: Who is described as coming humble and riding upon a colt in Zechariah 9?
questions.explanation: The future king is described as coming lowly, riding on a donkey's colt.

questions.question: What will the LORD do to the pride of Assyria and the sceptre of Egypt according to Zechariah 10?
questions.explanation: God declares He will bring down the pride of Assyria and remove Egypt's sceptre.

questions.question: In Zechariah 10, what are the house of Judah and Joseph compared to?
questions.explanation: They are likened to strong horses prepared for battle.

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 11 contains a prophecy about a foolish shepherd being appointed over the flock.
questions.explanation: The chapter describes a foolish shepherd who does not care for the flock.

questions.question: What will happen to the shepherd in Zechariah 11 who is rejected by the flock?
options: He will be given a reward
questions.explanation: The foolish shepherd is destined for destruction because he did not care for the flock.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'And in that day there shall be a great ______ from the LORD among them.'
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:13 mentions a great tumult from the LORD in that day.

questions.question: In Zechariah 14, where will the LORD's feet stand on the day of battle?
questions.explanation: The LORD will stand on the Mount of Olives which will split in two.

questions.question: What will flow out from Jerusalem in Zechariah 14?
questions.explanation: Living waters will flow from Jerusalem to both seas in summer and winter.

questions.question: True or False: According to Zechariah 14, the LORD will be king over all the earth and His name will be one.
questions.explanation: God's kingdom will be universal and His name one in that day.

questions.question: What punishment will befall the enemies who fight Jerusalem according to Zechariah 14?
options: Their flesh, eyes, and tongue will consume away
questions.correctAnswer: Their flesh, eyes, and tongue will consume away
questions.explanation: A plague will cause their bodies to waste away while standing.

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 13 predicts that false prophets will be cut off from the land.
questions.explanation: False prophets will be removed to purify the land.

questions.question: In Zechariah 13, what will happen to the idols in the land?
questions.explanation: Idols and false prophets will be removed to cleanse the land.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Awake, O sword, against my shepherd, and against the man that is my fellow, saith the LORD of hosts; smite the ______, and the sheep shall be scattered.'
questions.explanation: The shepherd will be struck causing the sheep to scatter.

questions.question: Who will be saved as God's flock in Zechariah 10?
questions.explanation: The LORD will visit and save His flock, the house of Judah.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 9, what will happen to the battle bow of the enemies?
options: It will be used to conquer
questions.explanation: The bow of the enemy will be broken, and peace will come.

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 8 encourages the people to speak truth, execute judgment, and bring peace.
questions.explanation: The chapter exhorts people to live righteously and peacefully.

questions.question: In Zechariah 12, what will happen to the inhabitants of Jerusalem when all nations come against it?
options: They will be delivered by God
questions.correctAnswer: They will be delivered by God
questions.explanation: God promises to make Jerusalem a cup of trembling and defend it Himself.

questions.question: What does Zechariah 8 say about the future prosperity of Jerusalem?
options: It will be prosperous and many nations will be joined
questions.correctAnswer: It will be prosperous and many nations will be joined
questions.explanation: God promises restoration, peace, and many nations joining Jerusalem.

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 14 describes a day that will be neither day nor night but will have light at evening time.
questions.explanation: The day is unique and known to the LORD alone with unusual light conditions.

questions.question: What is described as being spread abroad through prosperity in Zechariah 1?
questions.explanation: God promises that His cities will be spread abroad through prosperity.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Not by might, nor by power, but by my ______, saith the LORD of hosts.'
questions.explanation: The rebuilding will be accomplished by the Spirit of God, not by human strength.
